entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French comparison, from Latin comparation-, comparatio, from comparare

def.dt: :the act or process of comparing: as
:the representing of one thing or person as similar to or like another
:an examination of two or more items to establish similarities and dissimilarities his faults seem minor by comparison
:identity of features :similarity several points of comparison between the two
:the modification of an adjective or adverb to denote different levels of quality, quantity, or relation
:to compare prices (as of competing brands) in order to find the best value
